meanings.definition: To abandon one's allegiance or duty and return to a former position or state.
meanings.sent1: After realizing his mistake, John was redefecting back to his original team.
meanings.sent2: She was redefecting from the new company to her old job.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be redefecting between sleeping on the couch and the bed all day.
meanings.sent4: The river kept redefecting its course after heavy rains, causing flooding in the area.
meanings.sent5: The student kept redefecting between studying for the test and watching TV, unable to focus.

meanings.definition: The act of changing sides or loyalties again.
meanings.sent1: The redefecting of the politician surprised many of his supporters.
meanings.sent2: The spy's redefecting caused chaos in the intelligence community.
meanings.sent3: The redefecting of the weather from sunny to rainy caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent4: The redefecting of the colors in the painting gave it a dynamic feel.
meanings.sent5: The redefecting of alliances in the game kept the players on their toes.
